alert.note: Alert for Bear Lake Valley; Bear River Range; Big Hole Mountains; Blackfoot Mountains; Caribou Range; Centennial Mountains, Island Park; Franklin, Eastern Oneida Region; Marsh and Arbon Highlands; Raft River Region; Sawtooth, Stanley Basin; Southern Hills, Albion Mountains; Sun Valley Region; Teton Valley (Idaho) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Storm Watch issued November 30 at 3:39AM MST until December 03 at 5:00AM MST by NWS Pocatello
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WATCH IN EFFECT FROM LATE TONIGHT THROUGH LATE SATURDAY NIGHT... * WHAT...Heavy snow. Two-day total snow accumulations of 12 to 18 inches, with up to 2 and half feet on ridge tops and elevations above passes possible. Winds could gust as high as 40 mph. * WHERE...Western Central Mountains, Southern Hills/Albion Mountains, and Eastern Highlands including Galena Summit, Sweetzer Summit, Malad Pass, Holbrook Summit, Emigration Pass, Geneva Summit, Georgetown Summit, Fish Creek Summit, Pine Creek Pass, Ashton Hills, Raynolds Pass, and Targhee Pass. * WHEN...From late tonight through late Saturday night. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult to impossible, especially mountain passes. The hazardous conditions could impact the morning or evening commute.
info.instruction: Monitor the latest forecasts for updates on this situation.
